text: Seventy-second session
Agenda item 136
Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 5 July 2018
[on the report of the Fifth Committee (A/72/681/Add.2)]
72/262.	Special subjects relating to the programme budget for the biennium 2018–2019
C
The General Assembly,
Status of implementation of the information and communications technology strategy for the United Nations

Recalling section II of its resolution 60/283 of 7 July 2006, its resolutions 63/262 of 24 December 2008, 63/269 of 7 April 2009 and 64/243 of 24 December 2009, section XVII of its resolution 65/259 of 24 December 2010, its resolution 66/246 of 24 December 2011, section I of its resolution 67/254 A of 12 April 2013, section XV of its resolution 68/247 A of 27 December 2013, section II of its resolution 69/262 of 29 December 2014, paragraph 107 of its resolution 70/247 of 23 December 2015, section V of its resolution 70/248 A of 23 December 2015, section II of its resolution 70/238 B of 1 April 2016, section III of its resolution 71/272 B of 6 April 2017 and its resolution 71/281 of 6 April 2017,

Having considered the report of the Secretary-General, the note by the Secretary-General transmitting the first annual progress report of the Board of Auditors on the implementation of the information and communications technology strategy and the related report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions

textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the report of the {{Secretary-General}}, the note by the {{Secretary-General}} transmitting the first annual progress report of the {{Board of Auditors}} on the implementation of the information and communications technology strategy and the related report of the {{Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions}},

text: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General;1
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}};1

text: Also takes note of the findings of the report of the Board of Auditors,2 and endorses the recommendations contained therein;
textWithHighlights: Also *takes note* of the findings of the report of the {{Board of Auditors}},2 and *endorses* the recommendations contained therein;

text: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions;3

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions

textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the {{Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions}};3
uncertainties: ACABQ is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; normalized here as ACABQ and classified under UN Organs (subsidiary body of the GA).

text: Estimates in respect of special political missions, good offices and other political initiatives authorized by the General Assembly and/or the Security Council
Recalling section XXII of its resolution 72/262 A of 24 December 2017 and its resolution 72/263 A of 24 December 2017,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* section XXII of its resolution 72/262 A of 24 December 2017 and its resolution 72/263 A of 24 December 2017,

text: Having considered the reports of the Secretary-General on the estimates in respect of special political missions, good offices and other political initiatives authorized by the General Assembly and/or the Security Council concerning the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan and the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq, and the related reports of the Advisory Committee,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ)

textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the reports of the {{Secretary-General}} on the estimates in respect of special political missions, good offices and other political initiatives authorized by the {{General Assembly}} and/or the {{Security Council}} concerning the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}} and the {{United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq}}, and the related reports of the {{Advisory Committee}},
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" is interpreted as the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), which is not explicitly listed in the entities; classified as 'other'.

text: Takes note of the reports of the Secretary-General;4,5
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the reports of the {{Secretary-General}};4,5

text: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the reports of the Advisory Committee,6 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the conclusions and recommendations contained in the reports of the {{Advisory Committee}},6 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
uncertainties: The 'Advisory Committee' is assumed to refer to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ); categorized as 'other' since ACABQ is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list.

text: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
Decides to reduce resources for operational costs by 2,000,000 United States dollars;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Reduction of resources for operational costs by 2,000,000 USD

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to [[reduce resources]] for operational costs by 2,000,000 United States dollars;
uncertainties: Assignee is implicit (the General Assembly). Treated the budget reduction as a financial_resources deliverable.

text: Takes note of paragraph 20 of the report of the Advisory Committee, and decides to establish one position of Senior Programme Officer (P-5) within the proposed Donor Coordination Section;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Establish Senior Programme Officer (P-5) position in Donor Coordination Section
deliverables.deliverable: one position of Senior Programme Officer (P-5)

textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of paragraph 20 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}}, and *decides* to establish [[one position of Senior Programme Officer (P-5)]] within the proposed Donor Coordination Section;
uncertainties: Assumed the assembly is the General Assembly based on GA-style resolution numbering. Deliverable type classified as 'policy' since establishing a post is an institutional change; staffing does not map perfectly to the provided categories.

text: Decides not to establish one position of Assistant Human Rights Officer (National Professional Officer) in Herat, Afghanistan, and one position of Human Rights Database Manager (United Nations Volunteer);
textWithHighlights: *Decides* not to establish one position of Assistant Human Rights Officer (National Professional Officer) in Herat, {{Afghanistan}}, and one position of Human Rights Database Manager (United Nations Volunteer);
uncertainties: Assignee inferred as GA based on GA-style resolution numbering; the paragraph itself does not explicitly name the assignee. No deliverable extracted for the staffing decision to avoid misclassification (no clear deliverable category for establishing/abolishing posts).

text: United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq
Decides to reduce resources for operational costs by 2,000,000 dollars;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Reduction of resources for operational costs by 2,000,000 dollars

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to [[reduce resources]] for operational costs by 2,000,000 dollars;
uncertainties: Assignee is implicitly the General Assembly inferred from GA-style resolution numbering; deliverable categorized as financial_resources though it is a budget reduction rather than funding provision.

text: Recalls its stipulation that the use of external consultants should be kept to an absolute minimum and that the Organization should use its in-house capacity to perform core activities to fulfil functions that are recurrent over the long term;
textWithHighlights: *Recalls* its stipulation that the use of external consultants should be kept to an absolute minimum and that the {{Organization}} should use its in-house capacity to perform core activities to fulfil functions that are recurrent over the long term;
uncertainties: "Organization" is interpreted as referring to the United Nations (UN).

text: Reaffirms that the Fifth Committee is the appropriate Main Committee of the General Assembly entrusted with responsibility for administrative and budgetary matters;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* that the {{Fifth Committee}} is the appropriate Main Committee of the {{General Assembly}} entrusted with responsibility for administrative and budgetary matters;
uncertainties: "Fifth Committee" is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; treated as a UN Organ with free-text normalization.

text: Takes note of paragraph 12 of the report of the Advisory Committee, and decides to reclassify one position of Gender Adviser (P-4) as a position of Senior Gender Adviser (P-5);

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Reclassification of one position

textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of paragraph 12 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}}, and *decides* to [[reclassify one position]] of Gender Adviser (P-4) as a position of Senior Gender Adviser (P-5);

text: Decides not to establish one position of Human Rights Officer (P-4);
textWithHighlights: *Decides* not to establish one position of Human Rights Officer (P-4);

text: Urges the Secretary-General to continue his efforts to promote the nationalization of positions, whenever appropriate, as well as to build local capacity within the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq and to report thereon in the context of future budget submissions;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: nationalization of positions
local capacity building within UNAMI
report in future budget submissions

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq

textWithHighlights: *Urges* the <<Secretary-General>> to continue his efforts to promote the [[nationalization of positions]], whenever appropriate, as well as to [[build local capacity]] within the {{United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq}} and to [[report]] thereon in the context of future budget submissions;

text: Decides to approve a total amount of 255,924,400 dollars net of staff assessment for 2018 for the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (147,807,400 dollars) and for the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq (108,117,000 dollars);

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Funding for UNAMA and UNAMI for 2018

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to approve [[a total amount of 255,924,400 dollars]] net of staff assessment for 2018 for the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}} (147,807,400 dollars) and for the {{United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq}} (108,117,000 dollars);
uncertainties: Assignee is implicitly the General Assembly based on context; not explicitly named in the paragraph.

text: Also decides to approve a charge of 123,490,900 dollars against the provision for special political missions appropriated under section 3, Political affairs, of the programme budget for the biennium 2018–2019, after taking into account an amount of 132,433,500 dollars, approved for the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan and the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq and included as a portion of the charge against the provision for special political missions in accordance with General Assembly resolution 72/262 A;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Approval of budget charge for special political missions (2018–2019)

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq

textWithHighlights: Also *decides* to approve a [[charge of 123,490,900 dollars]] against the provision for special political missions appropriated under section 3, Political affairs, of the programme budget for the biennium 2018–2019, after taking into account an amount of 132,433,500 dollars, approved for the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}} and the {{United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq}} and included as a portion of the charge against the provision for special political missions in accordance with General Assembly resolution 72/262 A;

text: Revised estimates relating to the programme budget for the biennium 2018−2019 under section 3, Political affairs, and section 5, Peacekeeping operations, and the proposed budget for the support account for peacekeeping operations for the period from 1 July 2018 to 30 June 2019 related to the peace and security reform
Recalling its resolution 72/199 of 20 December 2017,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolution 72/199 of 20 December 2017,

text: Recalling also its resolution 70/262 of 27 April 2016 on the review of the United Nations peacebuilding architecture, and noting that the reform of the peace and security pillar is an opportunity to further advance and strengthen conflict prevention,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* its resolution 70/262 of 27 April 2016 on the review of the {{United Nations}} peacebuilding architecture, and *noting* that the reform of the peace and security pillar is an opportunity to further advance and strengthen conflict prevention,

text: Having considered the report of the Secretary-General and the related report of the Advisory Committee,
textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the report of the {{Secretary-General}} and the related report of the {{Advisory Committee}},
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" likely refers to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), but the text is not explicit.

text: Commending the Secretary-General for his efforts to enhance the performance of the peace and security pillar of the Secretariat,
textWithHighlights: *Commending* the {{Secretary-General}} for his efforts to enhance the performance of the peace and security pillar of the {{Secretariat}},

text: Stressing that the actions to restructure the United Nations peace and security pillar should be implemented with full respect for the relevant mandates, decisions and resolutions of the General Assembly and of the Security Council, without changing established mandates, functions or funding sources of the peace and security pillar,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing* that the actions to restructure the United Nations peace and security pillar should be implemented with full respect for the relevant mandates, decisions and resolutions of the {{General Assembly}} and of the {{Security Council}}, without changing established mandates, functions or funding sources of the peace and security pillar,

text: Stressing also that the prevention of conflicts remains a primary responsibility of States and that actions by the United Nations undertaken within the framework of conflict prevention should support and complement, as appropriate, the conflict prevention roles of national Governments,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing also* that the prevention of conflicts remains a primary responsibility of {{States}} and that actions by the {{United Nations}} undertaken within the framework of conflict prevention should support and complement, as appropriate, the conflict prevention roles of {{national Governments}},

text: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General;9
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}};9

text: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee,10 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the {{Advisory Committee}},10 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" is assumed to refer to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ).

text: Reiterates its support for the vision of the Secretary-General for reforming the peace and security pillar, and welcomes the whole-of-pillar approach to integrating political and operational responsibilities;
textWithHighlights: *Reiterates* its support for the vision of the {{Secretary-General}} for reforming the peace and security pillar, and *welcomes* the whole-of-pillar approach to integrating political and operational responsibilities;

text: Endorses the establishment of the Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs and the Department of Peace Operations;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Establishment of DPPA and DPO

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs

textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the [[establishment]] of the {{Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs}} and the {{Department of Peace Operations}};
uncertainties: Classified the establishment of departments under deliverable type 'policy' (institutional reform); could arguably be seen as 'infrastructure' but it is not physical infrastructure.

text: Recognizes the complementary roles of cultural change, leadership and accountability in the success of structural changes;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the complementary roles of cultural change, leadership and accountability in the success of structural changes;

text: Notes that dual reporting lines will exist between the Assistant Secretaries-General heading the single political-operational structure and the Under-Secretaries-General for Peace Operations and for Political and Peacebuilding Affairs, and requests the Secretary-General to keep the implementation of dual reporting lines arrangements under close review and to take concrete actions to ensure that line management within the single political-operational structure is clear, coherent and accountable;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Review of dual reporting lines implementation

textWithHighlights: *Notes* that dual reporting lines will exist between the {{Assistant Secretaries-General}} heading the single political-operational structure and the {{Under-Secretaries-General}} for Peace Operations and for Political and Peacebuilding Affairs, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to keep the implementation of dual reporting lines arrangements under close [[review]] and to take concrete actions to ensure that line management within the single political-operational structure is clear, coherent and accountable;
uncertainties: Considered but did not extract a deliverable for "take concrete actions" because it is too vague without a specific action defined.

text: Also notes the intention of the Secretary-General to establish and chair a Standing Principals’ Group to provide unified leadership for strategic, political and operational responsibilities to facilitate coherence at Headquarters and in the field, and requests the Secretary-General, without prejudice to the decision taken in the present resolution, to present information on, inter alia, its functioning and composition, to the General Assembly at the main part of its seventy-third session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on the Standing Principals’ Group functioning and composition

textWithHighlights: Also *notes* the intention of the {{Secretary-General}} to establish and chair a Standing Principals’ Group to provide unified leadership for strategic, political and operational responsibilities to facilitate coherence at Headquarters and in the field, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>>, without prejudice to the decision taken in the present resolution, to present [[information]] on, inter alia, its functioning and composition, to the {{General Assembly}} at the main part of its seventy-third session;
uncertainties: Deliverable type could be interpreted as an update/briefing rather than a formal report; the text says 'present information' rather than 'report'.

text: Recalls paragraph 22 of the report of the Advisory Committee, and decides not to approve the relocation of the D-2 post from New York to Nouakchott;
textWithHighlights: *Recalls* paragraph 22 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}}, and *decides* not to approve the relocation of the D-2 post from New York to Nouakchott;
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" most likely refers to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ). The clause "decides not to approve the relocation" could be modeled as a policy deliverable, but given its negative/denial nature and lack of a follow-up task, it has been omitted to stay conservative.

text: Decides to establish four stand-alone divisions for Africa, effective from 1 January 2019, within approved resources, and requests the Secretary-General to present to the General Assembly at the main part of its seventy-third session information on the organizational structure, taking into account views expressed by Member States;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Establishment of four stand-alone Africa divisions
Information on organizational structure

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to establish [[four stand-alone divisions for Africa]], effective from 1 January 2019, within approved resources, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to present to the {{General Assembly}} at the main part of its seventy-third session [[information on the organizational structure]], taking into account views expressed by {{Member States}};
uncertainties: Classifying the establishment of organizational divisions as deliverable type 'policy' (institutional reform) rather than 'infrastructure' is somewhat subjective.

text: Affirms, after considering the report of the Secretary-General, “Middle East Division” as the name of the related new regional division;
textWithHighlights: *Affirms*, after considering the report of the {{Secretary-General}}, “Middle East Division” as the name of the related new regional division;
uncertainties: "Affirms" is not explicitly listed among operative verbs; it is treated here as a deciding verb because it sets the official name of a division. The assignee (GA) is implicit as the deciding body.

text: Decides to place the current lead responsibility for the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan and the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq in the Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Place lead responsibility for UNAMA and UNAMI in DPPA

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq
Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to place the current [[lead responsibility]] for the {{United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan}} and the {{United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq}} in the {{Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs}};

text: Recalls paragraph 32 of the report of the Advisory Committee, and decides to consider the three posts in the context of resolution 72/288 of 5 July 2018 on the support account for peacekeeping operations;
textWithHighlights: *Recalls* paragraph 32 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}}, and *decides* to consider the three posts in the context of resolution 72/288 of 5 July 2018 on the support account for peacekeeping operations;
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" is assumed to refer to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), which is not explicitly listed; normalized as ACABQ under type "other".

text: Takes note of paragraph 42 of the report of the Advisory Committee;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of paragraph 42 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}};
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" most likely refers to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ).

text: Recognizes the important contribution and increasing role of the police component in peacekeeping operations, including their peacebuilding efforts, and requests the Secretary-General to conduct an assessment on the functions, structure, capacity and level of the Police Division in the new structure and to report thereon to the General Assembly at its seventy-third session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assessment of Police Division functions and structure
Report to General Assembly

textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* the important contribution and increasing role of the police component in peacekeeping operations, including their peacebuilding efforts, and *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to conduct an [[assessment]] on the functions, structure, capacity and level of the Police Division in the new structure and to [[report]] thereon to the {{General Assembly}} at its seventy-third session;

text: Requests the Secretary-General to address the issue of equitable geographical representation of Member States, in conformity with Article 101 of the Charter of the United Nations, at all levels of the two Departments and to intensify his efforts to ensure proper representation of troop-contributing countries in the relevant new departments, taking into account their contributions to United Nations peacekeeping, and to report thereon in the context of future overview reports;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on equitable geographical representation and representation of troop-contributing countries

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to address the issue of equitable geographical representation of {{Member States}}, in conformity with Article 101 of the Charter of the United Nations, at all levels of the two Departments and to intensify his efforts to ensure proper representation of {{troop-contributing countries}} in the relevant new departments, taking into account their contributions to United Nations peacekeeping, and to [[report]] thereon in the context of future overview reports;
uncertainties: "address the issue" and "intensify his efforts to ensure proper representation" are not captured as deliverables due to their vagueness; only the reporting requirement is treated as a concrete deliverable.

text: Also requests the Secretary-General to undertake a comprehensive review of the implementation of the present resolution and to report thereon to the General Assembly at the main part of its seventy-fifth session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: review of implementation of the present resolution
report on the implementation review to GA

textWithHighlights: Also *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to undertake a [[comprehensive review]] of the implementation of the present resolution and to [[report]] thereon to the {{General Assembly}} at the main part of its seventy-fifth session;

text: Global service delivery model for the United Nations Secretariat

Recalling section III of its resolution 67/246 of 24 December 2012, paragraph 13 of section VII of its resolution 69/262 of 29 December 2014, paragraph 19 of its resolution 69/273 of 2 April 2015, section XIX of its resolution 70/248 A of 23 December 2015 and section XVII of its resolution 71/272 A of 23 December 2016,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* section III of its resolution 67/246 of 24 December 2012, paragraph 13 of section VII of its resolution 69/262 of 29 December 2014, paragraph 19 of its resolution 69/273 of 2 April 2015, section XIX of its resolution 70/248 A of 23 December 2015 and section XVII of its resolution 71/272 A of 23 December 2016,

text: Having considered the report of the Secretary-General and the related report of the Advisory Committee,
textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the report of the {{Secretary-General}} and the related report of the {{Advisory Committee}},
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" likely refers to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), but the paragraph does not specify this explicitly.

text: Having considered also the note by the Secretary-General transmitting the report of the Joint Inspection Unit entitled “Administrative support services: the role of service centres in redesigning administrative service delivery” and the note by the Secretary-General transmitting his comments and those of the United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination thereon,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination

textWithHighlights: *Having considered also* the note by the {{Secretary-General}} transmitting the report of the {{Joint Inspection Unit}} entitled “Administrative support services: the role of service centres in redesigning administrative service delivery” and the note by the {{Secretary-General}} transmitting his comments and those of the {{United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination}} thereon,

text: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General;11
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}};11

text: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee,12 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the {{Advisory Committee}},12 subject to the provisions of the present resolution;
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" is interpreted as the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), which is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; thus it is categorized as 'other' and normalized as ACABQ.

text: Takes note of paragraphs 10, 11 and 23 of the report of the Advisory Committee;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of paragraphs 10, 11 and 23 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}};

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly, no later than at the first resumed part of its seventy-third session, a new proposal for the global service delivery model which fully takes into account paragraph 5 of the report of the Advisory Committee and the comments, observations and recommendations of the Joint Inspection Unit,13 and to consult with Member States and relevant stakeholders and consider the views expressed by them.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Proposal for global service delivery model
Consultations with Member States and stakeholders

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to submit to the {{General Assembly}}, no later than at the first resumed part of its seventy-third session, a [[new proposal]] for the global service delivery model which fully takes into account paragraph 5 of the report of the {{Advisory Committee}} and the comments, observations and recommendations of the {{Joint Inspection Unit}},13 and to [[consult]] with {{Member States}} and relevant stakeholders and consider the views expressed by them.
uncertainties: "Advisory Committee" likely refers to the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), which is not explicitly listed; kept as a generic 'Advisory Committee' under 'other'.

text:
104th plenary meeting 
5 July 2018
